at least one handle selected from a set of different handle types each having a battery chamber and each being operable to be coupled to different ultrasonic waveguide types, the battery chamber having connectors therewithin and electrically connected to the ultrasonic-signal-generation assembly; and
a removable battery assembly having:
a housing with an exterior shape formed to removably connect with the battery chamber of each of the handles, the housing having:
at least one energy storage cell operable to power the ultrasonic-signal-generation assembly; and
a battery/handle interface having a plurality of connectors shaped to mate with the connectors within the battery chamber; and
a voltage-control circuit operable to:
communicatively couple with and provide power to the ultrasonic-signal-generation assembly;
detect which one of the ultrasonic waveguide types is coupled to the handle connected to the housing;
provide a first output in response to a detection of a first ultrasonic waveguide type; and
provide at least a second output in response to a detection of at least a second ultrasonic waveguide type.

9. The cordless, hand-held, ultrasonic cautery cutting device according to claim 8, wherein the voltage-control circuit comprises:
a processor communicatively coupled to the memory and operable to:
interrogate the surgical instrument handle for at least one piece of information pertaining to the surgical instrument handle;
receive an instruction from the memory corresponding to the at least one piece of information pertaining to the surgical instrument handle; and
drive the voltage-control circuit according to the instruction.
10. The cordless, hand-held, ultrasonic cautery cutting device according to claim 7, wherein the battery assembly is at least one of watertightly sealed and autoclavably sealed.

11. A cordless, hand-held, ultrasonic surgical device, comprising:
at least one handle selected from a set of different surgical handle types each having a battery chamber with connectors therewithin and each being operable to be coupled to at least one ultrasonic waveguide of a plurality of different ultrasonic waveguide types;
an ultrasonic-signal-generation assembly:
being operable to dynamically produce a resonant wave along the at least one ultrasonic waveguide; and
being electrically connected to at least some of the connectors within battery chamber; and
a battery assembly having:
a housing with an exterior shape formed to removably connect with the battery chamber of each of the different surgical handle types, the housing having:
at least one energy storage cell operable to power the ultrasonic-signal-generation assembly; and
a battery/handle interface having a plurality of connectors shaped to mate with at least some of the connectors within the battery chamber; and
a voltage-control circuit operable to:
communicatively couple with and provide power to the ultrasonic-signal-generation assembly;
detect from the at least one handle which one of the ultrasonic waveguide types is coupled to the at least one handle;
provide an output in response to the detected ultrasonic waveguide type.
12. The cordless, hand-held, ultrasonic surgical device according to claim 11, wherein the ultrasonic-signal-generation assembly is removably disposed at the at least one handle.
13. The cordless, hand-held, ultrasonic surgical device according to claim 11, wherein the battery assembly is removable.

14. The cordless, hand-held, ultrasonic surgical device according to claim 11, wherein the output is sufficient to drive the ultrasonic-signal-generation assembly to dynamically produce the resonant wave along the ultrasonic waveguide.

15. The cordless, hand-held, ultrasonic surgical device according to claim 11, wherein the output is an ultrasonic-signal-generation assembly output signal that is specific to the detected ultrasonic waveguide type.

16. The cordless, hand-held, ultrasonic surgical device according to claim 11, wherein the voltage-control circuit comprises a memory operable to receive and store at least one piece of information pertaining to the at least one handle.

17. The cordless, hand-held, ultrasonic surgical device according to claim 11, wherein the voltage-control circuit comprises:
a memory operable to receive and store at least one piece of information; and
a communication interface coupled to the memory and operable to communicate information from the memory to an information receiver remote from the battery assembly.

19. The cordless, hand-held, ultrasonic surgical device according to claim 11, wherein the voltage-control circuit comprises a memory operable to store at least two output voltage profiles, each profile corresponding to one of a surgical handle type and an ultrasonic waveguide attachment.

20. The cordless, hand-held, ultrasonic surgical device according to claim 19, wherein the voltage-control circuit comprises:
a processor communicatively coupled to the memory and operable to:
interrogate the at least one handle for at least one piece of information pertaining to the at least one handle;
receive an instruction from the memory corresponding to the at least one piece of information pertaining to the at least one handle; and
drive the voltage-control circuit according to the instruction.

title: Two -stage switch for cordless hand-held ultrasonic cautery cutting device
abstract: An ultrasonic, self-powered surgical device includes a handle, a self-contained power supply associated with the handle, and a control circuit disposed within the handle and/or the power supply. The control circuit is operable to carry out at least two operational conditions of the surgical device. A two-stage switch is electrically connected to the control circuit and effects the at least two operational conditions of the surgical device. A first stage of the switch effects a first of the at least two operational conditions and a second stage of the switch effects a second of the at least two operational conditions that is different from the first operational condition.

title: Cordless Hand-Held Ultrasonic Cautery Cutting Device
abstract: An ultrasonic surgical assembly includes a disposable ultrasonic waveguide, a reusable exterior body, and a cordless ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly removably disposed in the body and operable to generate ultrasonic movement of the waveguide when connected thereto. The assembly also includes a reusable and rechargeable battery disposed in the body, a disposable handle having both a waveguide attachment dock exposed to the environment and operably connecting the waveguide thereto and an aseptically sealable assembly dock exposed to the environment and shaped to connect the waveguide in the attachment dock to the assembly through the handle when the assembly is disposed in the assembly dock. The assembly further includes a disposable compartment door that is movably connected to the handle to selectively expose the assembly dock to the environment and has an open position, permitting entry and removal of the assembly respectively into and from the assembly dock, and a closed position, aseptically sealing the assembly dock from the environment.
claims:
2. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 1, wherein the ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly comprises:
a driving-wave generation circuit electrically coupled to the battery and having a generator output; and
an ultrasonic transducer communicatively coupled to the generator output.

3. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 2, wherein the driving-wave generation circuit comprises at least one of:
a control circuit;
a drive circuit; and
a matching circuit.

4. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 2, wherein the assembly body has an interior compartment and further comprising:
an assembly door movably connected to the assembly body to selectively expose the interior compartment to the environment and having:
an open position permitting entry and removal of at least one of the ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly and the battery respectively into and out from the interior compartment; and
a closed position sealing the interior compartment from the environment.
5. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 4, wherein the closed position at least one of water-tightly and aseptically seals the interior compartment from the environment.
6. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 2, wherein the transducer extends out of the assembly body.

7. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 2, wherein the handle further comprises a waveguide attachment dock exposed to the environment and operably connecting the waveguide to the handle.
8. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 7, wherein the attachment dock rotatably couples the waveguide to the assembly body.

9. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 7, wherein:
the attachment dock rotatably couples the waveguide to the assembly body;
the transducer is disposed rotatably in the ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly; and
the assembly dock connects the rotatable waveguide in the attachment dock to the rotatable transducer of the ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly to correspondingly rotate the transducer with respect to the assembly body with rotation of at least one of the waveguide and the attachment dock.
10. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 9, wherein the transducer is rotatable with respect to the driving-wave generation circuit.
11. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 1, wherein the assembly body is reusable.
12. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 1, wherein the handle is disposable.
13. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 1, wherein the ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly is powered only by the battery.

14. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 1, wherein the ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly is operable to vary at least one of a driving-wave frequency and a driving-wave power based on an identified type of the waveguide.

15. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 1, further comprising a device identifier communicatively coupled to the assembly dock and operable to communicate at least one piece of information about at least one of the waveguide, the ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly, the battery, the handle, and the door.

16. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 15, wherein the at least one piece of information is at least one of an identity of the handle, previous uses of the handle, an identity of the waveguide, previous uses of the waveguide, an identity of the battery, a status of the battery, previous uses of the battery, and a status of the door.

17. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 1, wherein the ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly is operable to vary at least one of a driving-wave frequency and a drive-wave power based on an identified type of the waveguide.
18. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 1, wherein the ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly has a display operable to display information.

19. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 18, wherein at least one of the door and the handle body has a transparent portion for viewing the display disposed within the handle body from outside the handle body.
20. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 1, further comprising a memory for storing a use history.

21. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 1, further comprising a device identifier communicatively coupled to the assembly dock and operable to communicate at least one piece of information about at least one of the waveguide, the battery, the handle, and the door.

22. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 21, wherein the at least one piece of information is at least one of a handle identifier, an information list of handle previous use, a waveguide identifier, an information list of waveguide previous use, a battery identifier, an information list of battery previous use, and a battery status.
23. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 21, wherein the device identifier is operable to communicate with the ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly.

24. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 1, wherein the handle further comprises an assembly ejector operable to cause at least a portion of the ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly to eject from the assembly dock.

title: Battery-powered hand-held ultrasonic surgical cautery cutting device
abstract: A removable battery assembly configured for use with an electrically powered surgical instrument operable to surgically interface with human tissue, the removable battery assembly comprising: an outer shell having an upper portion, a lower portion, and defining a shell interior, the outer shell configured to form a hand grip of an electrically powered surgical instrument when secured to the surgical instrument to permit handling of the surgical instrument by one hand of an operator, the upper portion configured to removably connect to a portion of the surgical instrument; and a rechargeable battery disposed in the shell interior and configured to power the surgical instrument, wherein the outer shell includes a plurality of exterior contacts electrically coupled to the rechargeable battery and configured to supply power from the rechargeable battery to the surgical instrument to operate the surgical instrument.
claims: 2. The removable battery assembly according to claim 1, wherein the outer shell further includes a multi-lead battery terminal including the plurality of exterior contacts on an exterior side thereof and a plurality of interior contacts on an interior side thereof.

3. The removable battery assembly according to claim 2, wherein the plurality of exterior contacts are a plurality of contact pads, and wherein the plurality of interior contacts are a plurality of contact pins corresponding to the plurality of contact pads to electrically couple the rechargeable battery and the plurality of contact pads.

4. The removable battery assembly according to claim 2, wherein the outer shell is formed form first and second shell halves, and wherein the first and second shell halves and the multi-lead battery terminal cooperate to enclose the rechargeable battery within the shell interior.

5. The removable battery assembly according to claim 4, wherein the first and second shell halves and the multi-lead battery terminal cooperate to form a hermetic seal between a surgical environment and the shell interior.
6. The removable battery assembly according to claim 1, wherein the outer shell defines a catch configured to facilitate engagement connection of the outer shell with the surgical instrument.

7. The removable battery assembly according to claim 6, wherein the catch is configured to enable rotation of the outer shell relative to the surgical instrument to connect the battery body outer shell with the surgical instrument.

8. The removable battery assembly according to any one of claims 1 to 7, further comprising a release mechanism operably coupled to the outer shell and configured to facilitate disconnection of the outer shell from the surgical instrument.

9. The removable battery assembly according to claim 8, wherein the release mechanism is movable relative to the outer shell from an initial position to a release position to enable disconnection of the outer shell from the surgical instrument.

10. The removable battery assembly according to claim 9, wherein, a direction of movement of the release mechanism from the initial position to the release position is opposite a direction of movement of the outer shell to disconnect the outer shell from the surgical instrument, thereby inhibiting unintended disconnection of the outer shell from the surgical instrument.
11. The removable battery assembly according to any one of claims 1 to 10, wherein the plurality of exterior contacts includes at least one ground contact and at least one power contact.

12. The removable battery assembly according to claim 11, wherein the plurality of exterior contacts are configured such that, upon connection of the outer shell with the surgical instrument, the at least one ground contact is electrically coupled with a corresponding electrical interface of the surgical instrument prior to electrical coupling of the at least one power contact with a corresponding electrical interface of the surgical instrument.

13. The removable battery assembly according to any one of claims 1 to 12, further comprising a pressure valve extending through the outer shell, the pressure valve configured to regulate a pressure within the shell interior.

title: Battery-powered hand-held ultrasonic surgical cautery cutting device
abstract: A battery-powered, modular surgical device comprising an electrically powered surgical instrument that requires a pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy to complete a surgical procedure, and a power module assembly that has a battery that powers the surgical instrument and has a current state of electrical charge, and a control circuit that is electrically coupled to the battery and the surgical instrument and has a memory and a microprocessor. The microprocessor determines the current state of electrical charge of the battery, compares the current state of electrical charge to the pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy, permits the battery to discharge if the current state of electrical charge is above the pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy, and maintains the battery in a non-discharge state if the current state of electrical charge is below the pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy.
claims:
1. A battery-powered, modular surgical device, comprising:
an electrically powered surgical instrument interfacing with bodily tissue during surgery and requiring a pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy to power the surgical instrument completely through a surgical procedure; and
a power module assembly having:
at least one modular battery supplying power for the surgical instrument during use and having a current state of electrical charge; and
a control circuit electrically coupled to the at least one modular battery and to the surgical instrument and comprising a memory and at least one microprocessor:
the memory storing data regarding the pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy; and
the microprocessor being programmed:
to monitor and determine the current state of electrical charge of the at least one modular battery;
to compare the current state of electrical charge of the at least one modular battery to the pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy;
to permit the battery to discharge if the current state of electrical charge of the battery is above the pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy; and
to maintain the battery in a non-discharge state if the current state of electrical charge of the battery is below the pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy.
2. The surgical device according to claim 1, wherein the at least one modular battery is comprised of a plurality of rechargeable energy storage cells.

3. The surgical device according to claim 2, wherein the control circuit determines a current state of electrical charge of each of the plurality of rechargeable energy storage cells and to equalize the current state of electrical charge amongst the plurality of rechargeable energy storage cells.
4. The surgical device according to claim 1, wherein the control circuit determines the amount of power being discharged from the at least one modular battery.

5. The surgical device according to claim 1, wherein the control circuit determines the current state of electrical charge of the at least one modular battery prior to beginning the anticipated surgical procedure.

6. The surgical device according to claim 5, wherein the control circuit determines the current state of electrical charge of the at least one modular battery upon completion of the last, most-recent surgical procedure.
7. The surgical device according to claim 1, wherein the control circuit determines an internal temperature of the at least one modular battery.

8. The surgical device according to claim 7, wherein the control circuit prevents any power from being discharged by the at least one modular battery if the internal temperature of the at least one modular battery exceeds a given temperature.
9. The surgical device according to claim 1, wherein the control circuit determines an internal impedance of the at least one modular battery.

10. The surgical device according to claim 1, wherein the power module assembly further comprises a protection circuit interconnecting the at least one modular battery and the control circuit through at least one connection path such that the protection circuit is a conduit between the at least one modular battery and the control circuit.
11. The surgical device according to claim 1, wherein the surgical instrument is an ultrasonic surgical instrument.

12. A battery-powered, modular surgical device, comprising:
an electrically powered surgical instrument interfacing with bodily tissue during surgery and requiring a pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy to power the surgical instrument completely through a surgical procedure; and
a power module assembly having:
at least one modular battery supplying power for the surgical instrument during use and having a current state of electrical charge; and
a control circuit electrically coupled to the at least one modular battery and to the surgical instrument and comprising a memory and at least one microprocessor:
the memory storing data regarding the pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy; and
the microprocessor being programmed:
to monitor and determine the current state of electrical charge of the at least one modular battery;
prior to beginning an anticipated surgical procedure, to compare the current state of electrical charge of the at least one modular battery to the pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy; and
to permit the battery to discharge if the current state of electrical charge of the battery is above the pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy; and
to maintain the battery in a non-discharge state if the current state of electrical charge of the battery is below the pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy.
13. The surgical device according to claim 12, wherein the at least one modular battery is comprised of a plurality of rechargeable energy storage cells.
14. The surgical device according to claim 12, wherein the control circuit determines the amount of power being discharged from the at least one modular battery.

15. The surgical device according to claim 12, wherein the control circuit determines the current state of electrical charge of the at least one modular battery upon completion of the last, most-recent surgical procedure.
16. The surgical device according to claim 12, wherein the control circuit determines an internal temperature of the at least one modular battery.

17. The surgical device according to claim 16, wherein the control circuit prevents any power from being discharged by the at least one modular battery if the internal temperature of the at least one modular battery exceeds a given temperature.
18. The surgical device according to claim 12, wherein the control circuit determines an internal impedance of the at least one modular battery.

19. The surgical device according to claim 12, wherein the power module assembly further comprises a protection circuit interconnecting the at least one modular battery and the control circuit through at least one connection path such that the protection circuit is a conduit between the at least one modular battery and the control circuit.

20. A battery-powered, modular surgical device, comprising:
an electrically powered ultrasonic surgical instrument interfacing with bodily tissue during surgery and requiring a pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy to power the surgical instrument completely through a surgical procedure; and
a power module assembly having:
at least one modular battery supplying power for the surgical instrument during use and having a current state of electrical charge; and
a control circuit electrically coupled to the at least one modular battery and to the surgical instrument and comprising a memory and at least one microprocessor:
the memory storing data regarding the pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy; and
the microprocessor being programmed:
to monitor and determine the current state of electrical charge of the at least one modular battery;
to compare the current state of electrical charge of the at least one modular battery to the pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy; and
to maintain the battery in a non-discharge state if the current state of electrical charge of the battery is below the pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy.

title: Cordless hand-held ultrasonic cautery cutting device
abstract: An ultrasonic assembly that is removably connectable to an ultrasonic waveguide of an ultrasonic surgical handle includes a cordless ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly having an ultrasonic generator and an ultrasonic transducer electrically coupled to the generator and having an output couple, a shell housing therein the ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly and having a securing connection shaped to removably connect to the ultrasonic surgical handle. The output couple is operable to impart ultrasonic movement to the ultrasonic waveguide when the securing connection is connected to the ultrasonic surgical handle and the waveguide is connected to the output couple.
claims: 2. The assembly according to claim 1, wherein the shell is aseptically sealed.
3. The assembly according to claim 1, wherein the securing connection is shaped to removably connect to a rail of the ultrasonic surgical handle.
4. The assembly according to claim 1, wherein the securing connection is shaped to removably connect to an undercut slot of the ultrasonic surgical handle.
5. The assembly according to claim 1, wherein the resonant wave is a sine wave.
7. The assembly according to claim 6, wherein the shell is aseptically sealed.
8. The assembly according to claim 6, wherein the securing connection is shaped to removably connect to one of a rail and an undercut slot of the ultrasonic surgical handle.
9. The assembly according to claim 6, wherein the resonant wave is a sine wave.

10. An ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly to be removably connected to an ultrasonic waveguide of an ultrasonic surgical handle, the assembly comprising:
a cordless ultrasonic transducer having an external output couple operable to dynamically produce a resonant wave along the ultrasonic waveguide when the waveguide is connected to the output couple;
a tank circuit electrically connected to the transducer and tuned to match the transducer; and
an aseptically sealed assembly shell having:
disposed therein the transducer and the tank circuit;
an external securing connection shaped to removably connect the shell to the ultrasonic surgical handle; and
having an outer surface with electrically communicating contacts for supplying power within the shell.

11. The assembly according to claim 10, wherein:
the tank circuit includes an internal driving-wave generation circuit having a generator output; and
the transducer is communicatively coupled to the generator output.

12. The assembly according to claim 11, wherein the driving-wave generation circuit comprises at least one of:
a control circuit; and
a drive circuit.
13. The assembly according to claim 11, wherein the transducer is rotatable with respect to the driving-wave generation circuit.
14. The assembly according to claim 10, wherein the transducer and the tank circuit are powered only by the surgical handle.

15. The assembly according to claim 10, wherein:
the surgical handle has an internal battery; and
the transducer and the tank circuit are powered only by the battery.

16. The assembly according to claim 10, wherein:
the waveguide has an identification type; and
the tank circuit is operable to vary at least one of a driving-wave output frequency and a driving-wave output power based on the identification type.
17. The assembly according to claim 10, wherein the resonant wave is a sine wave.

title: Cordless Hand-Held Ultrasonic Cautery Cutting Device
abstract: An ultrasonic surgical assembly includes an ultrasonic transducer operable to convert a received motional current into a movement of a cutting blade of an ultrasonic waveguide, a measurement circuit connected in a parallel configuration with the ultrasonic transducer, a variable power source operable to supply current through a set of connection points to the parallel configuration and thereby create the motional current in the ultrasonic transducer, and a current controller operable to regulate the motional current by varying an output of the variable power source, thereby maintaining a substantially constant rate of movement of the cutting blade across a variety of cutting loads.
claims:
2. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 1, wherein:
the ultrasonic transducer has a first capacitance in a parallel configuration with a series configuration of a resistance, an inductance, and a second capacitance; and
the motional current flows through the series configuration.
3. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 2, wherein the measurement circuit is comprised of a third capacitance in a parallel configuration with the first capacitance.
4. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 3, wherein the variable power source is coupled to the third capacitance and the ultrasonic transducer.

5. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 4, wherein the current controller is operable to regulate the motional current by varying an output of the variable power source based upon a product of the current flowing through the third capacitance multiplied by a ratio between a value of the first capacitance and a value of the third capacitance subtracted from a total current flowing into the ultrasonic transducer.

6. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 1, wherein:
the current controller comprises a processor; and
the variable power source comprises a phase locked loop communicatively coupled to the processor and operable to determine a frequency of movement of the cutting blade; and
further comprising a memory communicatively coupled to the processor and operable to store a last frequency of blade movement.

7. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 1, further comprising a clamping mechanism having a range of clamping force values and being operable to place material in physical contact with the cutting blade, the current controller communicatively coupled to the clamping mechanism and operable to vary the motional current based upon a given clamping value within the range of clamping values.
8. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 1, wherein the variable power source comprises a removable battery.

11. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 10, wherein:
the current controller comprises a processor; and
the variable power source comprises a phase locked loop communicatively coupled to the processor and operable to determine a frequency of movement of the cutting blade; and
further comprising a memory communicatively coupled to the processor and operable to store a last frequency of blade movement.

12. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 10, further comprising a clamping mechanism having a range of clamping force values and being operable to place material in physical contact with the cutting blade, the current controller communicatively coupled to the clamping mechanism and operable to vary the motional current based upon a given clamping value within the range of clamping values.
13. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 10, wherein the variable power source comprises a removable battery.

16. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 15, wherein:
the current controller comprises a processor; and
the variable power source comprises a phase locked loop communicatively coupled to the processor and operable to determine a frequency of movement of the cutting blade; and
further comprising a memory communicatively coupled to the processor and operable to store a last frequency of blade movement.

17. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 15, further comprising a clamping mechanism having a range of clamping force values and being operable to place material in physical contact with the cutting blade, the current controller communicatively coupled to the clamping mechanism and operable to vary the motional current based upon a given clamping value within the range of clamping values.

title: Cordless hand-held ultrasonic cautery cutting device
abstract: An ultrasonic surgical waveguide driving assembly to be attached to a surgical ultrasonic instrument handle having a cordless power source therein and a waveguide, the assembly comprising: a removable shell housing a cordless ultrasonic transducer and having: an outer surface with at least one electrically conductive contact; an ultrasonic waveguide couple at which the transducer is operable to excite the waveguide attached thereto and produce movement at a portion of the waveguide sufficient to at least one of cut and cauterize human tissue; and an ultrasonic handle couple operable to substantially simultaneously connect: the transducer to the instrument handle; and the at least one electrically conductive contact to the power source.
claims:
1. An ultrasonic surgical waveguide driving assembly to be attached to a surgical ultrasonic instrument handle having a cordless power source therein and a waveguide, the assembly comprising:
a removable shell housing a cordless ultrasonic transducer and having:
an outer surface with at least one electrically conductive contact;
an ultrasonic waveguide couple at which the transducer is operable to excite the waveguide attached thereto and produce movement at a portion of the waveguide sufficient to at least one of cut and cauterize human tissue; and an ultrasonic handle couple operable to substantially simultaneously connect:
the transducer to the instrument handle; and the at least one electrically conductive contact to the power source.
2. The assembly according to claim 1, wherein the ultrasonic handle couple is operable to also substantially simultaneously connect the waveguide couple to the waveguide.
3. The assembly according to claim 1, wherein the shell includes a distal end at which is disposed the waveguide couple, the handle couple, and the at least one electrically conductive contact.
4. The assembly according to claim 1, wherein the transducer includes a cord-free proximal end.
5. The assembly according to claim 1, wherein the at least one electrically conductive contact is a pair of ring-shaped contacts.
6. The assembly according to claim 5, wherein the ring-shaped contacts circumscribe the waveguide couple.
7. The assembly according to claim 1, wherein the power source is a battery.
8. The assembly according to claim 7, wherein the battery is rechargeable.

9. The assembly according to claim 1, wherein the substantially simultaneous connection places the transducer in communicative contact with the power source one of before and upon finalizing mechanical connection of the transducer and the waveguide.

title: Cordless hand-held ultrasonic ablation cutting device
abstract: Abstract not found

title: Two-stage switch for surgical device
abstract: A self-powered surgical device, comprising a handle having a self-contained power supply and a control circuit operable to carry out at least two operational conditions of the surgical device; and a two-stage switch electrically connected to the control circuit, a first stage of the switch effecting a first of the at least two operational conditions and a second stage of the switch effecting a second of the at least two operational conditions that is different from the first operational condition, the two-stage switch having a variable resistance such that the first stage occurs when a first depression force is applied to the switch, the second stage occurs when a second depression force greater than the first depression force is applied to the switch, and a holding force lower than at least the second depression force is required to maintain the switch in the second stage.
claims:
1. A self-powered surgical device, comprising:
a handle having:
a self-contained power supply; and
a control circuit operable to carry out at least two operational conditions of the surgical device; and
a two-stage switch electrically connected to the control circuit, a first stage of the switch effecting a first of the at least two operational conditions and a second stage of the switch effecting a second of the at least two operational conditions that is different from the first operational condition, the two-stage switch having a variable resistance such that:
the first stage occurs when a first depression force is applied to the switch;
the second stage occurs when a second depression force greater than the first depression force is applied to the switch; and
a holding force lower than at least the second depression force is required to maintain the switch in the second stage.
2. The device according to claim 1, wherein the control circuit is operable to control the amount of power delivered from the power supply.

3. The device according to claim 2, wherein the first operational condition is a first amount of power delivered from the power supply and the second operational condition is a second amount of power delivered from the power supply.

4. The device according to claim 1, wherein the two-stage switch further comprises at least one electrical contact that is operable to electrically close the control circuit to affect the first and second of the at least two operational conditions.

5. The device according to claim 1, wherein the two-stage switch further comprises at least one electrical contact that is operable to electrically break the control circuit to affect the first and second of the at least two operational conditions.

6. The device according to claim 1, wherein the two-stage switch is operable to switch between the first and second stages by changing between a first position and a second position, whereby the switch is in the first position when the first depression force is applied and is in the second position when the second depression force is applied.
7. The device according to claim 6, wherein the two-stage switch is in the first stage when in the first position.
8. The device according to claim 7, wherein the two-stage switch is in the second stage when in the second position.
9. The device according to claim 8, wherein the first and second positions are operably connected in a stacked configuration.
10. The device according to claim 1, wherein the first depression force causes the switch to be partially depressed.
11. The device according to claim 10, wherein the second depression force causes the switch to be fully depressed.

12. The device according to claim 6, further comprising a plunger coupled to the two-stage switch and operable to change the positions of the two-stage switch when a pressure is applied to the plunger.
13. The device according to claim 12, wherein the plunger is spring-biased.
14. The device according to claim 12, wherein a variable amount of pressure is applied to the plunger to cause the two-stage switch to change position.

15. The device according to claim 12, wherein the amount of pressure needed to position the two-stage switch in the first stage is less than the amount of pressure needed to position the two-stage switch in the second stage.

16. The device according to claim 1, wherein the two-stage switch is comprised of at least a first sub-switch and a second sub-switch, the first sub-switch effecting the first stage and the second sub-switch effecting the second stage.

17. An ultrasonic, self-powered surgical device, comprising:
a handle having:
a self-contained power supply; and
a control circuit operable to carry out at least two operational conditions of the surgical device; and
a two-stage switch electrically connected to the control circuit, a first stage of the switch effecting a first of the at least two operational conditions and a second stage of the switch effecting a second of the at least two operational conditions that is different from the first operational condition, whereby the two-stage switch is operable to switch to the first stage and to the second stage by changing between first and second positions, the two-stage switch having a variable resistance such that:
the switch is in the first position when a first depression force is applied to the switch;
the switch is in the second position when a second depression force greater than the first depression force is applied to the switch; and
a holding force lower than at least the second depression force is required to maintain the switch in the second stage.

18. The device according to claim 17, wherein:
the two-stage switch is in the first stage when in the first position; and
the two-stage switch is in the second stage when in the second position.
19. The device according to claim 18, wherein the first and second positions are operably connected in a stacked configuration.

20. The device according to claim 17, wherein:
the first depression force cause the switch to be partially depressed; and
the second depression force causes the switch to be fully depressed.

21. The device according to claim 17, further comprising a plunger coupled to the two-stage switch and operable to change the position of the two-stage switch when a pressure is applied to the plunger.
22. The device according to claim 21, wherein the plunger is spring-biased.
23. The device according to claim 21, wherein a variable amount of pressure is applied to the plunger to cause the two-stage switch to change position.

24. The device according to claim 21, wherein the amount of pressure needed to position the two-stage switch in the first stage is less than the amount of pressure needed to position the two-stage switch in the second stage.

25. The device according to claim 17, wherein the two-stage switch is comprised of at least a first sub-switch and a second sub-switch, the first sub-switch effecting the first stage and the second sub-switch effecting the second stage.

title: Cordless hand-held ultrasonic cautery cutting device
abstract: An ultrasonic surgical assembly connectable to an ultrasonic surgical handle having an ultrasonic waveguide, the assembly comprising: an exterior body defining an internal compartment and having a connection operable to removably secure the body in a body-holding compartment within the ultrasonic surgical handle; a cordless ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly disposed in the internal compartment and having an output couple removably attachable to the ultrasonic waveguide and operable to impart ultrasonic movement to the ultrasonic waveguide; and a battery disposed in the internal compartment and electrically connected to and powering the ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly.
claims: 4. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 2, wherein the transducer is rotatable with respect to at least one of the body and the driving-wave generation circuit.

5. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 2, further comprising:
a reusable compartment door movably connected to the body to selectively expose the compartment to the environment and having:
an open position permitting entry and removal of at least one of the ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly and the battery respectively into and out from the compartment; and a closed position sealing the compartment from the environment.
6. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 5, wherein the closed position at least one of water-tightly and aseptically seals the compartment from the environment.
7. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 6, wherein the battery is interchangeably disposed in the body.
8. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to any one of claims 1 to 7, wherein the ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly is powered only by the battery.

9. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to any one of claims 1 to 8, wherein the ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly is operable to vary at least one of a driving-wave frequency and a driving-wave power based on an identified type of the waveguide.
10. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to any one of claims 1 to 9, wherein the output couple extends out of the body from the ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly.
11. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to claim 1, wherein the battery is interchangeably disposed in the body.

12. The ultrasonic surgical assembly according to any one of claims 1 to 11, wherein:
at least one of the exterior body and the cordless ultrasonic-movement-generation assembly is reusable.

title: Battery-powered hand-held ultrasonic surgical cautery cutting device
abstract: A battery-powered, modular surgical device comprising an electrically powered surgical instrument that requires a pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy to complete a surgical procedure, and a power module assembly that has a battery that powers the surgical instrument and has a current state of electrical charge, and a control circuit that is electrically coupled to the battery and the surgical instrument and has a memory and a microprocessor. The microprocessor determines the current state of electrical charge of the battery, compares the current state of electrical charge to the pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy, permits the battery to discharge if the current state of electrical charge is above the pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy, and maintains the battery in a non-discharge state if the current state of electrical charge is below the pre-determined minimum amount of electrical energy.
claims: 1-20. (canceled)

22. The method of claim 21, further comprising:
executing a Discrete Fourier Transform (DFT) algorithm based on the second amplified motional feedback signal, thereby computing the magnitude of the second amplified motional feedback signal and a phase of the second amplified motional feedback signal.
23. The method of claim 22, further comprising determining a frequency of the motional feedback signal based at least in part on the phase of the second amplified motional feedback signal.

24. The method of claim 23, further comprising:
determining whether the magnitude of the second amplified motional feedback signal is greater than a startup threshold; and
calculating, based on the frequency of the motional feedback signal, a frequency step of an adjustment to a frequency of the transducer input signal when it is determined that the magnitude of the second amplified motional feedback signal is greater than the startup threshold.

25. The method of claim 24, wherein the calculating the frequency step includes calculating a size of the frequency step and a direction of the frequency step, based on the frequency of the motional feedback signal.

26. The method of claim 24, further comprising:
determining whether a frequency based on the frequency step is within a range of frequencies; and
adjusting the frequency of the transducer input signal based on the frequency step, when it is determined that the frequency based on the frequency step is within the range of frequencies.
27. The method of claim 26, wherein the frequency of the transducer input signal is adjusted by way of a direct digital synthesizer.
28. The method of claim 24, wherein a size of the frequency step is based on a difference between the frequency of the motional feedback signal and a target frequency.
29. The method of claim 28, wherein the size of the frequency step is proportional to the difference between the frequency of the motional feedback signal and the target frequency.

30. The method of claim 28, wherein, based on the difference between the frequency of the motional feedback signal and the target frequency, one of a plurality of gain values is selected by which to calculate the frequency step.
31. The method of claim 30, wherein the plurality of gain values is stored in an index table.

32. The method of claim 21, further comprising:
providing, to a battery microcontroller of the battery assembly, a measurement of an amplitude of the motional feedback signal; wherein the battery microcontroller:
determines whether the measurement of the amplitude is within a target range; and
activates an amplitude feedback control loop when the measurement of the amplitude is within the predetermined target range.

33. The method of claim 32, wherein, if the measurement of the amplitude is within the predetermined target range, the battery microcontroller:
determines whether a predetermined time threshold has elapsed; and
deactivates the current signal when the predetermined time threshold has elapsed.

34. The method of claim 21, further comprising:
prior to the receiving of current signal, receiving an initialization signal from the battery assembly in response to actuation of a trigger.

35. The method of claim 34, wherein a battery microcontroller of the battery assembly:
determines whether an acknowledgment signal is received from a transducer and generator microcontroller within a predetermined time threshold; and
deactivates the current signal when the acknowledgment signal is not received within the predetermined time threshold.

title: Cordless Hand-Held Ultrasonic Cautery Cutting Device and Method
abstract: A disposable ultrasonic surgical handle connectable to an ultrasonic transducer, an ultrasonic waveguide, a battery, and an ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly, includes a handle body having a power supply portion defining a battery-holding compartment, the battery-holding compartment having at least two battery contacts, a waveguide attachment dock exposed to the environment and shaped to accept the waveguide therein, an ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly dock exposed to the environment and shaped to selectively removably secure the ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly to the handle body and electrically couple the ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly to the battery contacts, and a transducer attachment dock exposed to the environment and shaped to substantially simultaneously place the ultrasonic transducer in coaxial alignment with the waveguide when the waveguide is disposed within the waveguide attachment dock and electrically couple the ultrasonic transducer to the ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly when the ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly is secured to the ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly dock. The battery can be removable.
claims:
1. A disposable ultrasonic surgical handle connectable to an ultrasonic transducer, an ultrasonic waveguide, a battery, and an ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly, the handle comprising:
a handle body having:
a power supply portion defining a battery-holding compartment and having at least two battery contacts at the battery-holding compartment;
a waveguide attachment dock exposed to the environment and shaped to accept the ultrasonic waveguide therein;
an ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly dock exposed to the environment and shaped to selectively removably secure the ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly to the handle body and electrically couple the ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly to the at least two battery contacts; and
a transducer attachment dock exposed to the environment and shaped to substantially simultaneously:
place the ultrasonic transducer in coaxial alignment with the ultrasonic waveguide when the ultrasonic waveguide is disposed within the waveguide attachment dock; and
electrically couple the ultrasonic transducer to the ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly when the ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly is secured to the ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly dock.

2. The disposable ultrasonic surgical handle according to claim 1, wherein:
the battery is a removable battery; and
the battery-holding compartment comprises a selectively accessible and aseptically sealable compartment shaped to receive the battery therein.

3. The disposable ultrasonic surgical handle according to claim 1, wherein the handle body further comprises:
an upper handle portion; and
a lower grip portion defining therein the battery-holding compartment.

4. The disposable ultrasonic surgical handle according to claim 1, wherein:
the battery is a removable battery; and
the battery-holding compartment further comprises a battery ejector operable to cause at least a portion of the removable battery to eject from the battery-holding compartment.

5. The disposable ultrasonic surgical handle according to claim 1, wherein:
the battery is a removable battery; and
further comprising a compartment door movably attached to the handle body at the battery-holding compartment and having:
an open position permitting entry and removal of the removable battery respectively into and from the battery-holding compartment; and
a closed position aseptically sealing the battery-holding compartment from the environment.
6. The disposable ultrasonic surgical handle according to claim 1, wherein the ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly dock is one of a rail, a dovetail, a T-slot, and an undercut slot.

7. The disposable ultrasonic surgical handle according to claim 1, further comprising:

8. The disposable ultrasonic surgical handle according to claim 1, further comprising:

9. The disposable ultrasonic surgical handle according to claim 8, wherein the at least one piece of information is at least one of a handle identifier, an information list of previous use, a waveguide identifier, and a transducer identifier.

10. The disposable ultrasonic surgical handle according to claim 8, further comprising a removable battery assembly including a removable battery, the device identifier operable to communicate with the removable battery assembly and transfer information therebetween.

11. The disposable ultrasonic surgical handle according to claim 1, wherein:
the waveguide attachment dock is shaped:
to rotatably connect the ultrasonic waveguide to the ultrasonic transducer when the ultrasonic waveguide is in the waveguide attachment dock and when the ultrasonic transducer is in the transducer attachment dock; and
to allow the ultrasonic transducer and the ultrasonic waveguide to correspondingly rotate with respect to the handle body and the ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly.

13. The disposable ultrasonic surgical handle according to claim 11, wherein:
the waveguide attachment dock and the transducer attachment dock are disposed to directly physically couple the ultrasonic waveguide and the ultrasonic transducer and cause a corresponding rotation of the ultrasonic transducer with respect to the handle body when at least one of the ultrasonic waveguide and the ultrasonic transducer rotates.

14. The disposable ultrasonic surgical handle according to claim 12, wherein:
the ultrasonic transducer has an output couple;
the ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly generates an output waveform; and
the transducer attachment dock is shaped to connect the output couple to the ultrasonic waveguide in the waveguide attachment dock and ultrasonically move the ultrasonic waveguide with the output waveform when attached thereto.

15. The disposable ultrasonic surgical handle according to claim 12, wherein:
the ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly comprises at least one of:
a control circuit;
a drive circuit; and
a matching circuit.
16. The disposable ultrasonic surgical handle according to claim 12, wherein the ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly is aseptically sealed.

17. The disposable ultrasonic surgical handle according to claim 16, further comprising:
a removable battery; and
the ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly comprises:
power contacts electrically coupling the ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly to the removable battery; and
output contacts supplying an ultrasonic driving wave to the ultrasonic transducer.
18. The disposable ultrasonic surgical handle according to claim 12, further comprising a removable battery comprising a plurality of Lithium-Ion cells electrically connected together in series.

19. The disposable ultrasonic surgical handle according to claim 1, further comprising:

the battery is a removable battery comprising a power source and a power-source controller, the power-source controller being operable to select one of a set of different battery output powers dependent upon the at least one piece of information.

20. The disposable ultrasonic surgical handle according to claim 12, wherein:

the ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly is operable to vary at least one of the driving-wave frequency and the driving-wave power based on an identified one of the waveguide types.

21. A disposable ultrasonic surgical handle connectable to an ultrasonic transducer, an ultrasonic waveguide, a removable battery, and an ultrasonic-signal-generator assembly, the handle comprising:
